Literature.Title: Culture-independent discovery of the malacidins as calcium-dependent antibiotics with activity against multidrug-resistant Gram-positive pathogens.
Literature.Author: Hover BM, Kim SH, Katz M, Charlop-Powers Z, Owen J, Ternei MA, Maniko J, Estrela AB, Molina H, Park S, Perlin DS, Brady SF

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus USA 300(MIC=0.2-0.8µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus USA 300(MIC=>100µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus USA 300(MIC=>100µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus USA 300(MIC=5µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus COL(MIC=0.2-0.8µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus NRS 100(MIC=0.2-0.8µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus NRS 108(MIC=0.2-0.8µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium(MIC=0.8-2.0µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium Com15(MIC=0.8-2.0µg/ml),Streptococcus pneumoniae TCH8431(MIC=0.1-0.2µg/ml),Streptococcus mutans UA159(MIC=0.1-0.2µg/ml),Bacillus subtilis 168(MIC=0.2-0.4µg/ml),Lacticaseibacillus rhamnosus NCTC 13031(MIC=0.1-0.2µg/ml),Escherichia coli BAS 849(MIC=>100µg/ml),Escherichia coli DH5alpha(MIC=>100µg/ml),Candida albicans ATCC 1884(MIC=>100µg/ml),Cryptococcus neoformans ATCC 32045(MIC=>100µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii ATCC 17978(MIC=>100µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 10031(MIC=>100µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa PAO1(MIC=>100µg/ml),Salmonella enterica serovar Typhimurium IR715(MIC=>100µg/ml)
